intro: Scorzoneroides pyrenaica subsp. helvetica, commonly known as the Pyrenean helvetian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered with a fine pubescence, aiding in water retention. This subspecies is of particular interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological significance in high-altitude ecosystems.
